statements: SELECT * FROM A_B_Testing_Analysis;
SELECT test_name, metric_1, metric_2 FROM A_B_Testing_Analysis ORDER BY test_name ASC;
SELECT test_id, test_name, metric_3 FROM A_B_Testing_Analysis WHERE metric_1 > 0;
SELECT test_name FROM A_B_Testing_Analysis WHERE metric_2 IS NOT NULL ORDER BY test_name DESC;
SELECT test_id, test_name, metric_1, metric_2, metric_3 FROM A_B_Testing_Analysis WHERE metric_3 < 0.5 ORDER BY test_id DESC;
SELECT test_id, test_name, metric_1, metric_2, metric_3 FROM A_B_Testing_Analysis;
SELECT test_name, metric_1, metric_3, metric_2, test_id FROM A_B_Testing_Analysis;
SELECT test_id, metric_1, test_name, metric_3, metric_2 FROM A_B_Testing_Analysis;
SELECT test_id, test_name, metric_1 + metric_2 + metric_3 AS total_metric FROM A_B_Testing_Analysis;
SELECT * FROM A_B_Testing_Analysis WHERE metric_2 > 0.5;
SELECT * FROM experiment_results WHERE metric_name = 'accuracy';
SELECT metric_name, metric_value FROM experiment_results WHERE metric_value > 0.9 ORDER BY metric_value DESC;
SELECT experiment_id, COUNT(*) as num_records FROM experiment_details GROUP BY experiment_id;
SELECT * FROM experiment_details WHERE end_date > '2022-01-01' AND start_date < '2022-01-31';
SELECT experiment_id, AVG(metric_value) as avg_value FROM experiment_results GROUP BY experiment_id HAVING avg_value > 0.8;
SELECT * FROM experiment_results WHERE metric_name = 'accuracy' ORDER BY metric_value DESC;
SELECT experiment_name, start_date, end_date FROM experiment_details WHERE start_date > '2022-01-01' AND end_date < '2022-12-31';
SELECT experiment_id, AVG(metric_value) AS average_metric_value FROM experiment_results GROUP BY experiment_id HAVING COUNT(experiment_id) > 2;
SELECT experiment_id, experiment_name, metric_name, metric_value FROM experiment_results JOIN experiment_details ON experiment_results.experiment_id = experiment_details.experiment_id;
SELECT DISTINCT experiment_id, metric_name FROM experiment_results ORDER BY experiment_id ASC, metric_name DESC;
SELECT experiment_id, experiment_name, metric_name, metric_value FROM A/B_testing_metrics;
SELECT * FROM Experiment_results ORDER BY date DESC;
SELECT experiment_id, user_name, group_name FROM Experiment_users WHERE experiment_id = 1;
SELECT experiment_id, metric_name, metric_value FROM A/B_testing_metrics WHERE metric_value > 0.5;
SELECT user_id, experiment_id, user_name, group_name FROM Experiment_users ORDER BY user_id ASC;
SELECT * FROM A/B_testing_metrics WHERE metric_value > 0.5 ORDER BY metric_value DESC;
SELECT experiment_name, metric_name FROM A/B_testing_metrics WHERE metric_value < 0.2;
SELECT user_name, group_name FROM Experiment_users ORDER BY user_name ASC;
SELECT experiment_id, AVG(result_value) AS average_result FROM Experiment_results GROUP BY experiment_id;
SELECT experiment_name, metric_name, result_value FROM A/B_testing_metrics JOIN Experiment_results ON A/B_testing_metrics.experiment_id = Experiment_results.experiment_id WHERE result_value > 0.3;
SELECT * FROM performance_metrics;
SELECT test_group, metric_name FROM performance_metrics WHERE metric_value > 0;
SELECT * FROM test_runs ORDER BY start_time DESC;
SELECT test_group, COUNT(*) FROM test_results GROUP BY test_group;
SELECT group_name, description FROM test_groups WHERE group_id IN (1, 3, 5);
SELECT * FROM performance_metrics ORDER BY metric_name ASC, metric_value DESC;
SELECT metric_name, AVG(metric_value) FROM performance_metrics GROUP BY metric_name;
SELECT test_group, COUNT(*) FROM test_runs WHERE start_time >= '2022-01-01' GROUP BY test_group HAVING COUNT(*) > 1;
SELECT tr.run_id, tr.metric_name, tr.metric_value FROM test_results tr JOIN test_runs trs ON tr.run_id = trs.run_id WHERE trs.start_time BETWEEN '2022-01-01' AND '2022-02-01';
SELECT t.group_name, t.description, COUNT(trs.run_id) FROM test_groups t LEFT JOIN test_runs trs ON t.group_id = trs.group_id GROUP BY t.group_name, t.description HAVING COUNT(trs.run_id) > 0;
SELECT * FROM experiment_results;
SELECT experiment_id, metric_1, metric_2 FROM experiment_results ORDER BY experiment_id DESC;
SELECT experiment_id, AVG(metric_1) AS avg_metric1 FROM experiment_results GROUP BY experiment_id;
SELECT * FROM variations WHERE experiment_id = 1;
SELECT experiment_name, start_date, end_date FROM experiments WHERE experiment_id = 3;
SELECT * FROM experiment_results WHERE metric_1 > 0.8 ORDER BY metric_2 DESC LIMIT 5;
SELECT experiment_name, start_date, end_date FROM experiments WHERE start_date >= '2022-01-01' AND end_date <= '2022-06-30';
SELECT variation_name, experiment_name FROM variations INNER JOIN experiments ON variations.experiment_id = experiments.experiment_id WHERE variation_name LIKE '%control%' ORDER BY experiment_id ASC;
SELECT metric_name, AVG(metric_value) AS average_value FROM performance_metrics GROUP BY metric_name HAVING COUNT(experiment_id) > 10;

SELECT experiment_id_1, experiment_id_2, comparison_metric, comparison_result FROM comparison_results WHERE experiment_id_1 < experiment_id_2 AND comparison_result = 'significant' ORDER BY comparison_metric ASC;
